bibl.title: Letter from Mary Fishback to Philip Showalter Hench, September 16, 1940

div1.p: Fishback identifies the newspaper articles sent to Hench about the Public Health Association meeting, in 1900, and notes that a library employee is related to Gorgas.

div1.head: Letter from Mary Fishback to Philip Showalter Hench, September 16, 1940
div1.opener:
INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC LIBRARY
MERIDIAN AT SAINT CLAIR
INDIANAPOLIS, INDIANA
L. L. DICKERSON
L I B R A R I A N
Reference Department
September 16, 1940
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench-
div1.p:
We received your letter with the
check this morning, and wish to thank you for
your promptness, also we appreciate the thoughtfulness
about the postage.

I am so sorry I did not mark the print of the Sentinel
article with pen; perhaps you have discovered the
dim pencil notation along the side by now.
Anyhow, the article was in the Indianapolis Sentinel,
October 24, 1900. - The Journal was the morning paper
and the Sentinel the evening. -

This whole transaction has been very interesting and
pleasant. My only regret is that the chief of this
department was on vacation until this week, because I
think you would have had a “kick” from receiving letters
signed by Mary V. Gorgas. Her Father was a cousin of
Dr. William Gorgas. (And, she would probably
take me to task for telling you, if she knew it!)
